content:
IRowsetChange Interface

Definition

Provides an implementation of the OLE DB IRowsetChange interface for use by applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("0C733A05-2A1C-11CE-ADE5-00AA0044773D")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IRowsetChange

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Methods

DeleteRows(Int32,Int32,Int32[],Int32[])

Deletes rows.

public void DeleteRows (int hChapterReserved, int cRows, int[] rghRows, out int[] rgRowStatus);
hChapterReserved
Int32

The chapter handle.

cRows
Int32

The number of rows to be deleted.

rghRows
Int32[]

An array of handles of the rows to be deleted.

rgRowStatus
Int32[]

An array with cRows elements in which to return values indicating the status of each row specified in rghRows.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

InsertRow(Int32,Int32,IntPtr,Int32)

Creates and initializes a new row.

public void InsertRow (int hChapterReserved, int hAccessor, IntPtr pData, out int hRow);
hChapterReserved
Int32

The chapter handle.

hAccessor
Int32

The handle of the accessor to use.

pData
IntPtr

A pointer to memory containing the new data values, at offsets that correspond to the bindings in the accessor.

hRow
Int32

A pointer to memory in which to return the handle of the new row.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

SetData(Int32,Int32,IntPtr)

Sets data values in one or more columns in a row.

public void SetData (int hRow, int hAccessor, IntPtr pData);
hRow
Int32

The handle of the row in which to set data.

hAccessor
Int32

The handle of the accessor to use.

pData
IntPtr

A pointer to memory containing the new data values, at offsets that correspond to the bindings in the accessor.

Remarks

Note

Functions and objects in the N:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic 2008. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
